oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Medical saddle bags of confederate Veteran Dr. Samuel Houston Caldwell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These medical saddle bags belonged to Dr. Samuel Houston Caldwell who served as a surgeon on the staff of Gen. Forrest. Dr. Caldwell continued to practice medicine in Henry County, Tennessee after the war and probably used these bags. They are marked; Sharp & Smith which did not exist prior to 1876. Bags of this type appear in an 1889 catalogue for Sharps & Smith. The center leather piece has detoriated from Dr. Caldwell's saddle bags. Dr. Caldwell died in 1917.
